content.description: Great route! Crux comes pretty high.

Reach out left off the boulder over the abyss and clip the first bolt. From there, climb up and left and follow a set of bolts to a midway station (12b/c-ish). Mostly the rock is good to this midway station, minus some large suspect underclings that must be clung to clip the 5th bolt out left (only place good enough rock for a bolt could be found in this area). After the midway station (clipped from another suspect undercling), climb up a suspect flake/tower, clip a bolt, and continue up and left to a chossy ledge. From the ledge, move back right, if you dare, to another set of suspect laybacks on a hollow flake. Continue the face to the top.Suggestion: Stop at the midway station (6 bolts and two chains) and call it good at 12b/c; this is an awesome route of its own with just a little hollow choss at the underclings. The hollow flake above the midway station is sketchy, IMO, and simply not worth the risk.
content.protection: 11 bolts & 2-bolt anchor, or 6 bolts and 2-bolt anchor to mid-station.
content.location: This is the furthest left route on the East face after you scramble up the ledges with the first set of fixed handlines.

content.description: Climbs the flake to the right of the prominent crack to a perplexing bulge.  Surmount this obstacle, and delicately climb the crack/chimney without dislodging any rocks on to your belayer.
content.location: Just to the right of Humboldt Haze.  Shares anchors.

content.description: Cruiser 5.11 "crack" climbing to a midstation anchor.  From here, head up a few moves before breaking right on a rail to acquire the crux draw, and wish there were more between here and the next....Unlock some absurd sequence ending on a good clipping hold and crimp to the top.
content.location: Next-to-last route to the right, on the Southeast face.  Above both of the hand lines.  Can't miss the crack start!

content.description: The crux of the route is within the first 4-5 bolts with another game-on section a couple of bolts higher; then its relatively more manageable after that (12a/b-ish to the anchor). From the midway chain anchor, the route veers up and left a little with a bit of a run to the next bolt.
content.protection: 14 bolts. 80m ropes gets you down easily.
content.location: This route is in the middle of the SE Face and starts just left of some large chockstones in the gulley at the base of the wall. You can reach out left and clip the 2nd and 3rd bolts from the chockstone/boulder.

content.description: Crystal Balls is on the upper level of the SE face of the massive Phalanx of Will. The line starts at a shared start with Cumulus Locos and breaks right at some blocky flakey terrain. The line climbs through some of the better rock on the tower and has several cruxes, none of which are too crazy hard. Very fun movement of flakes, slopers and edges.
content.protection: 14 bolts to clips and lowers. 70m gets you down.
content.location: SE face of the tower. Starts off a square block with a low bolt that can be clipped from the ground

content.description: Some of the most high quality rock and best lines are found on this side of the Phalanx of Will! Slopers, sharp crimps, and larger features take you all the way to the top of the tower. Endurance is the name of the game. Adventurous sport climbing!
